alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:26AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McIntosh and central Muskogee Counties through 415 AM CDT... At 326 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles east of Boynton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Warner... Oktaha... Braggs... Boynton... Rentiesville... Greenleaf State Park... Keefeton... Wainwright... Summit... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 271 and 278. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
